name: Krishna Mishra
warning_signs: Decreased urine output or dark-colored urine
follow_up_instructions: Weigh yourself daily and report sudden weight gain (>2 lbs in 24 hours)
Attend dialysis sessions as scheduled (3 times per week)
Monitor blood pressure daily and log readings
Schedule lab work for kidney function tests in 2 weeks
discharge_summary:
Patient Krishna Mishra was admitted on 2025-09-14 with Kidney Stones (Nephrolithiasis). 
During hospitalization, patient was managed with Sodium bicarbonate 650mg three times daily, Sevelamer 800mg with meals, Amlodipine 5mg daily. 
Procedures performed included Kidney stone removal (ureteroscopy).
Patient's condition improved and was stable at discharge. 
Discharged home with instructions to follow up with nephrologist and continue medications as prescribed. 
Patient educated on warning signs and dietary restrictions.
